source.name: C5 1.1 KA
source.instructions: You store personal documents and spreadsheets with a cloud provider. You would like your data to be available only to people having a special unlock key. What should you apply to your documents and spreadsheets?

source.name: CYK 1.1
source.instructions: Use the dropdown arrow to select the term that fits best in each blank.  Each term is used only once.
source.text: <<<Cryptography>>> is the science of encoding or <<<encrypting>>> readable messages, also called <<<plaintext>>>, using a(n) <<<encryption key>>> to create unreadable messages called <<<ciphertext>>>. To read encrypted messages, you need a(n) <<<decryption key>>>.  In symmetric key cryptography, the same key is used to encrypt and to decode, or <<<decrypt>>>, the message.

text: is the science of encoding or
. To read encrypted messages, you need a(n)
.  In symmetric key cryptography, the same key is used to encrypt and to decode, or

source.name: CYM 1.1
source.instructions: Which form of modern symmetric cipher is the most secure?
